name: conceivably

possibly: She could conceivably have already left. Conceivably, some brain cells could be damaged during this process. See

Thesaurus: synonyms, antonyms, and examples
used to say you are not certainmaybe"Do you want to go to the show tonight?" "Maybe. Let's see how I feel after work."perhapsPerhaps he'll decide to join us tonight.possiblyThere are four, possibly five people who have been injured in the explosion.potentiallyThese potentially unsafe chemicals are present in our groundwater.conceivablyIt would be hard, but a burglar could conceivably shut down your electronic alarm system by hacking into it. plausiblyShe argued, rather plausibly, that her neighbour was the one who took the tools from her allotment.

More examplesFewer examplesThe number of dead could conceivably be 5,000 to 10,000.I am very worried as to what might conceivably happen in the next 20 months.Airport fees conceivably could affect the airline's long-term plans for growth.
